greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Index of the first occurrence of n in A092953. There are a(n) primes p < n such that n+p is a prime.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: a(6) = 24 as there are 6 values the prime p can take, 5, 7, 13, 17, 19 and 23 < 24 so that 24 + p is also prime.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Mar 24 2004
ext: More terms from _Klaus Brockhaus_ and Mohammed Bouayoun (bouyao(AT)wanadoo.fr), Mar 25 2004
